IV. PAUSANIAS.

The most illustrious deedl os Pausanias the Lacedaemonian was that he defeated Mardonius at Plataea. After the battle of Plataea, Pausanias was so elated by the victory, that he wrote on the tripod which he set up at Delphi that he had conquered the Lacedaemoniam at Plataea. The Lacedaemoniam, however, when they had erased the epigram which Pausanias had written, wrote nothing but the names of the States whose forces had

been present² at the battle.
